channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pothole increasingly dangerous and growing daily, 28th February
item.description:
Directly as you turn left from Tewkesbury Road into Elm Street. This pothole has been increasing in size and you can now see beige surface where tarmac has been worn down. Large amount of displaced grit/stone on highway from the crumbling.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elm Street, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No yellow lines, 28th February
item.description:
Junction of Francis Street & Exmouth Street, since recently resurfacing this area the yellow lines on this awkward junction have not been restored. Careless parking here now makes navigating difficult, on a corner where five roads join. An accident waiting to happen.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37, Langdon Road, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple pot holes in main carriageway, 28th February
item.description:
At the end of Tone Drive as you turn left or right into Wye Road there are multiple pot holes some deeper than others. You had a team of road workers out on Thursday but it seems they may have only bothered filling one pot hole. The road surface is failing in it’s current state.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wye Road, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole hasn't been fixed even though you think it has!, 28th February
item.description:
Hi. I reported this problem and was told it was being fixed. The had a report to say that it has been done. It hasn't been done at all and I'm not sure what you might have been told about it. The day you told me work had been done, there was a maintenance lorry outside but it was merely parked with what I cold see to be a flat tyre. No work was being or subsequently was done here. I'm really disappointed becasue the Council thinks this work is done, as I assume the contractors have marked it as complete. But I haven't see anyone assessing it, reviewing it and definitely not fixing it. Photo was taken on the day you said it had been fixed and it looks exactly like the previous photo I shared! Needless to say, house continues to shake when anyone hits this

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Sydenham Road South, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple severe potholes all along on greyhound gardens, 28th February

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Greyhound Gardens, Elmbridge, Gloucester
